page.title: 02Schools
page.content: In our area there are 7 schools, 6 lower schools and 1 middle school. Ecton Village School - in 1752 John Palmer started a school for poor children -in 1876 a new school was uilt for 175 pupils. It cost $2,000. In 1983 there were only 11 pupils, and the school was to be shut. However it was reprieved and now children from the Eastern District go there. There are 40 pupils in the two classes. Bellinge Lower opened 10 years ago and only 23 children attended,there were 2 teachers. Now there are 280 pupils on roll. Ecton Brook Lower is 4 years old. 260 children go to the school which is open-plan. Ecton Brook Middle is 3 years old. 390 children from the surrounding areas attend. Great Billing school was built in 1903. It is aided by the Church of England. There are 140 children on roll
